segments.text: The water is just pouring out of the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she’s just standing there, drying a plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea what they’re up to.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever turn around and see the mess behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over any second.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her cookie, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the woman turns around before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is both funny and terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know I should.
segments.speaker: PAR
